column4: a few years ago a friend had told me about mythtv.  i have recently begam migrating away from windows; is mythtv still a good application to build my media center?  i am running ubuntu 10.10 (64bit)  any insight appreciated.
I use XBMC too...but myth is great if you plan on watching or recording live TV
mythbuntu is just a package in ubuntu...it helps configure all the components surrounding mythtv
if you plan to record mythtv-backend is the way to go
I have a machine running mythtv-backend that records but all the rest of the media centers in my house use XBMC as the frontend
yeah you should be able to find mythbuntu in synaptic...I forget the actual package name right now
so if i understand correctly, youre using myth to perfom all your recording - but on the other workstations you use xbmc as a front end to access the media from myth?
myth has it's quirks and is a bit of a maintenance nightmare...also somewhat sluggish compared to XBMC...
yep...!
so a few years ago the package was myth tv - has mythbuntu replaced myth tv?

no...mythbuntu started as a seperate project based on ubuntu...eventually Ubuntu adopted the project in as a package that can just be installed (rather than a standalone OS)...mythtv is a completely separate project...mythbuntu just makes it a little easier to manage
sry...mythbuntu makes it easier to manage and install myth tv in ubuntu... :)
I think you just need to install mythbuntu-control-centre...it will pull the rest with dependencies...
by dl'ing control center, will is pull the backend as well...i have search all mythbuntu and do not see the backend, nor front end

the control center is just a piece of software to manage myth and it's environment (by adding and removing packages, AND settings etc)...so with the CC you can tell it to install just a backend for example
check System
thank you
np!
so, is this a correct assumption - i will build a mythbuntu box...and, if i throw xbmc on my laptop can i stream data from my mythbuntu box to my laptop?
yep...the only thing you can't see in XBMC is the live recordings...so if you want to watch live TV or a show that is being recorded you will need a myth frontend
clarification, i can stream any data, just not live data?  so a show previously recorded would play fine on xbmc laptop?
tell her it's worth it...my wife loves the setup now... :)
